Dear Ms. Anderton:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel at 616-204-6992.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Cathrine Raftery, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to
Section requirements; staff qualifications
Description (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation There are concerns that various staff members have provided
youth with the vapes and alcohol on various dates since
03/30/2023. On an unknown date, staff member has provided
vapes to youth and allowed youth to use the vapes at various
times. In June 2023, staff allowed youth to "hit a passion fruit
flavor vape" while in the car when they were together at the
camping trip. Staff also allows youth to vape during check-ins
without permission. On another unknown date, other staff member
provided youth with 99 Banana's which is an alcohol that he
provided after youth's pet spider died. Staff also gave youth his
cherry cola breeze vape to use; and gave youth a vape but youth
gave it back. On another unknown date, another staff allowed
youth to use a vape with in the last couple weeks, and other staff
allowed youth to hit her vape while coming back from school
orientation in the facility van.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 11, 2023, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth
A reported staff at the facility have been providing them with alcohol
and vapes. When asked for more details, Youth A began to explain
each of the occurrences. They reported Staff 2 provided them with
alcohol the Tuesday or Wednesday before they went on the camping
trip. Youth A reported they were so excited to go on the trip they
could not sleep so they were up in their room. They reported Staff 2
had asked Youth A how much they loved them. Youth A reported
they told Staff 2 they loved them a lot and asked why and Staff 2
gave them a clear bottle that had the label of 99 Bananas, which was
a mini bottle of alcohol. They reported Staff 2 gave them the bottle
because their pet stink bug died a week before and Staff 2 told them
“Bottoms up for the bug.”. Youth A reported Staff 2 watched them
drink the bottle and then he left. They reported no one else was
present when this occurred. Youth A reported one night when they
got back from an outing using the public pool, Staff 2 went on a walk
2

with them outside the home around 9:30 pm. They reported on this
walk, Staff 2 allowed Youth A to use their cherry cola vape pen and
made sure the cameras outside the home could not see them. Youth
A reported Staff 2 allowed them to keep this vape. Youth A reported
Staff 1 allowed Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C to use Staff 1’s vape.
Youth A reported in the middle of June, Staff 1 was driving Youth A
and Youth C back from an outing in the facility’s van when Staff 1
allowed them to use their vape. Youth A reported this was a Breezy
Pro vape pen that had a watermelon taste. They reported Staff 1 has
also continuously let Youth A use the vape whenever they do a
check-in with Youth A in their room. Youth A reported they will be in
their room and Staff 1 will sit in the doorway and will pass them the
vape pen to use. They reported Staff 1 also passed them the vape
when they went to Captain Jay’s Chicken. Youth A reported the last
time they used Staff 1’s vape was about three weeks ago. They
reported there was another incident when they went camping and
Staff 1 drove Youth A and Youth B to the outhouse area and allowed
both youth to use Staff 1’s vape. Youth A reported Staff 5 witnessed
Youth A use the vape and stated that she did not care. Youth A
reported when she went to the grocery store with Staff 1 they met up
with Staff 3 and Youth A witnessed both staff use their vapes. They
reported staff did not allow them this time to use the vape because
they were sick. Youth A reported about 4-5 weeks ago when they
needed to go to urgent care, Staff 3 transported them and vaped in
the facility van. They reported they asked Staff 3 if they could use
Staff 3’s vape and he asked Youth A how old they were first. Youth A
told staff they were 17 years old, and Staff 3 then allowed Youth A to
use their vape. They reported the vape was a mint-flavored Breezy
pen. Youth A reported Staff 4 and Staff 5 picked them up in the
facility van after school orientation. Staff 4 was smoking their vape in
the van and asked Youth A if that was okay. Youth A reported they
asked Staff 4 if they could use their vape and Staff 4 allowed them.
They reported this vape had a minty flavor to it. Youth A reported
when they went AWOL in June 2023, Staff 5 went to pick them up
from the apartment complex. Youth A reported Staff 5 was smoking a
CBD cigarette in front of them but never allowed Youth A to use it.
Youth A reported they wanted to tell their therapist and foster care
worker all of this because they want to stop ruining their life with
substances.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at school on September
13, 2023, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth B reported
he has only used vapes when he goes AWOL with other youth. He
reported he has never seen a staff member use a vape. Youth B
reported staff have never offered or provided him a vape and he has
never heard staff offer a vape to another youth. Youth B reported he
heard rumors that a youth is saying staff allows them to vape. He
reported he has heard Youth A will ask staff to use a vape and
3

doesn’t know why they would ever ask that. Youth B reported Youth
A has also stated Staff 4 physically attacked her and he reported that
is not true. When asked if Youth B went on the camping trip, he
reported he only went for one night. He reported he did drive with
staff to use the restroom but could not remember which staff it was.
Youth B reported he never saw anyone use any vapes on the
camping trip and he never used a vape there.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at school on September
11, 2023, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth C reported
he does use vapes and he gets them from school, when he is AWOL,
or just by finding them on the ground outside the facility. He denied
any staff member had provided him with vapes or any other
contraband such as alcohol. Youth C reported he can get his vapes
on his own with no help from staff and he is the one bringing them
into the facility. He reported no one will be able to find where he is
hiding them. Youth C reported he has never seen a staff member use
a vape or smoke any substance. He denied there has been smoking
in a vehicle with a staff member. Youth C reported he does not even
know what staff members use vapes at the facility and no staff
member has ever offered him to use a vape.
Youth D was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 11, 2023, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. They
reported they had heard rumors that Staff 8 had tried to force the
youth to give him hugs. Youth D disclosed they heard this from Youth
A and Youth E, but this has never happened to them, and they have
never seen this happen. When asked if anyone at the facility had
given them contraband items, Youth D denied this. Youth D reported
they have not heard any rumors of staff providing the youth a vape.
They reported they have heard rumors that certain staff members will
turn a blind eye if they see a youth using a vape and some staff will
not perform a full search when the youth return from AWOL. Youth D
reported they heard Staff 1 pretended they did not see Youth A,
Youth B or Youth C have or use a vape. They reported they have
heard Staff 3 has also not redirected youth when they have had
vapes. Youth D reported they heard Staff 2 does not perform a full
search when a youth returns from AWOL. They have heard youth will
get the vapes from school previously but not sure how they are now
getting them. Youth D reported they have never seen a staff member
vape. They reported staff never allows Youth D to get away with
anything and always performs a full search on them when they return
from AWOL.
Youth E was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 13, 2023, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth
E reported no staff has ever offered her vapes or alcohol at the
facility. She reported she had not seen a staff member use a vape.
4

Youth E reported Youth A has reported Staff 2 has allowed them to
vape. She reported she does not like Staff 2 and believes he comes
off as perverted. Youth E stated Staff 2 had just given a bunch of
hugs but had never touched them inappropriately. She reported she
saw Staff 2 looking at her butt before. When asked about Staff 8,
Youth E reported Staff 8 has a hard time forming a connection with
the youth and she can’t have a conversation with him. She reported
when Staff 8 sees her crying he tries to force her to talk about her
emotions and has continued to offer hugs to help console her. Youth
E reported there was never a forced hug and the hug never felt
inappropriate.
Youth F was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 22, 2023, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth
F reported she went on the camping trip. She reported memories of
the camping trip are a bit blurry due to it being so long ago. Youth F
reported Staff 5 took herself and Youth A to use the bathroom and
there were no concerns. She remembered nothing out of the ordinary
had happened during the camping trip. Youth F reported she did hear
rumors Youth A is saying Staff 4 is providing vapes to the youth. She
reported this is not true. Youth F stated she has never seen a staff
member vape and they have never offered her a vape. Youth F
reported she has never seen a staff member give a vape or alcohol
to a youth.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on September
13, 2023, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Law enforcement
was present for this interview. Staff 1 reported Staff 5 told her she
was being interviewed because Youth A was telling people staff were
allowing them to vape. Staff 1 reported she does use a vape but
does not use one when she is working. Staff 1 reported she has
never offered a youth to use her vape or given a vape to a youth.
She reported the youth, including Youth A, will go AWOL to use
substances. She reported when the youth returned, she has
confiscated vapes from them and noted she took a charging cord
from Youth A that is used to charge the vape. Staff 1 reported she
has transported Youth A and Youth C in the facility van before and it
was about a month and a half ago. She reported she never used her
vape at that time or witnessed the youth use a vape. Staff 1 stated
she also took Youth A out to pick up food in the facility van. She
stated she never used her vape or saw Youth A use a vape on that
trip. Staff 1 was asked if she had ever taken Youth A to the grocery
store and met up with Staff 3. She reported she has taken Youth A to
the grocery store but has never met up with Staff 3 there. Staff 1
reported she did transport Youth B to the camping trip in her personal
car. When she got to the camping area Youth A asked to use the
restroom and Staff 1 took her to the restroom. Staff 1 reported when
she arrived at the bathroom Youth F and Staff 5 were already in
5

there using the restrooms. She reported Youth A was in the
bathroom stall, Staff 1 bent down to tie her shoe and her vape fell out
of her front pocket. Staff 1 reported Staff 5 came out of the bathroom
stall and asked Staff 1 what fell out of her pocket. Staff 1 stated she
told Staff 5 it was her vape and reported no youth saw the vape fall
out. She reported she only had her vape with her because she was
just transporting a youth to the campsite, was in her personal car,
and was not staying. Staff 1 reported she never allowed Youth A to
use her vape on the camping trip. She reported Staff 5 texted Staff 1
after Staff 1’s interview with consultant, MDHHS, and law
enforcement informing her what she said in her interview. Staff 1
reported she did not know why Staff 5 was saying she was not in the
bathroom first with Youth F and provided the text message to this
consultant and MDHHS worker. She reported the youth have always
asked her to use her vape and she tells them no. She reported the
most recent time Youth A asked to use their vape was about two
weeks ago. Staff 1 reported Youth A has made comments to her that
if they do not get their way, they will find a way to get what they want.
She reported she caught Youth A with a vape in August 2023 and
Youth A reported they got it from a friend. Staff 1 reported she would
never provide a vape to the youth. When asked why she would bring
her vape to the camping trip when she is aware of the facility policy,
she explained she brought it just because she was dropping a youth
off. She stated there was one other time she brought her vape onto
campus, but she was not clocked in, she was just saying goodbye to
a youth that was discharging. Staff 1 reported when she is working,
she does not bring her vape.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on September
22, 2023, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. He reported he
was not sure why he had to be interviewed. When asked if he uses a
vape, Staff 2 reported he does not. He reported he does not know of
any other staff on campus that use vapes. He reported staff cannot
smoke on campus and should never have that type of item on them
or in their car when at the facility. Staff 2 reported he has never seen
or heard of staff providing youth vapes. He stated there has been
vapes confiscated from youth when youth are returning from AWOL.
Staff 2 described the process of what a staff member has to do when
a youth returns from AWOL and noted in detail the search process.
He reported they can take contraband items away from the youth
when they are found in their room or personal items when returned
from AWOL. Staff 2 was asked if he heard of staff providing youth
alcohol and reported he had not heard of that. He reported he has
never provided a youth with alcohol. When asked about his
relationship with Youth A, he reported he has a positive relationship
with Youth A as well as all the youth and does not give anyone
special treatment. He noted he is like a mentor to the youth, give
them guidance, and will listen to their concerns. Staff 2 reported he
6

would go to other houses to check on the youth when they are awake
in the middle of the night to talk with them. When asked if he does
that with Youth A specifically, he stated he does do check-ins at night
with Youth A if they are a wake in the middle of the night. When
asked if Youth A likes to have pet bugs, Staff 2 reported Youth A has
had multiple pet bugs. He reported he does not specifically
remember when Youth A’s pet stink bug died but remembers he has
processed with them sometimes about their pet bugs passing away.
He reported he has never given Youth A alcohol. Staff 2 does not
know why the youth are saying that he or other staff are providing
them with alcohol and vapes. He stated he has never done that and
does not know of any staff that would do that.
Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on September
13, 2023, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Law enforcement
was present for this interview. Staff 3 reported he was aware there
were allegations that staff were providing youth with vapes. He
reported Staff 1 had told him that she was under investigation and
felt that she was getting set up. Staff 3 reported he also believes he
heard this from Staff 5 as well. Staff 3 reported he does use a vape
but does not bring it to the facility or keep it in his car. He stated that
does not have concerns with his co-workers providing vapes to youth
and he stated he has never heard these allegations from the youth.
Staff 3 reported he never met up with Staff 1 and Youth A at Meijer
before. He reported he did take Youth A to urgent care recently when
they were not feeling well. He reported he did not bring his vape into
the van. He stated Youth A and Youth C have asked him for a vape
before, but he has told them no. Staff 3 reported he does not know
how the youth know he uses a vape.
Staff 4 was interviewed face to face at the facility on September
13, 2023, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Law enforcement
was present for this interview. Staff 4 reported a couple of days
ago, Staff 5 called her to tell her Youth A is telling people she allows
them to vape. She reported on Monday, September 11, 2023, she
did confront Youth A about them saying that to people. Staff 4
reported she asked Youth A why they would say that and Youth A did
not react well ran out of the house. When asked why she confronted
Youth A about this, she reported she did this because she had to
protect herself and clear her name. She reported there was no other
staff or youth around when she confronted Youth A about this. Staff 4
reported last week she went into Youth A’s room because she
believed Youth A had a vape but did not find it. She reported she has
told Youth A before that she never brings her vape to work and that
Youth A should not vape. Staff 4 reported she does not keep her
vape in her car when she comes to work. When asked about picking
up Youth A from school with Staff 5, she stated she did but never
brought a vape with her in the car. She reported she never smoked a
7

vape in the van, never offered Youth A a vape, and never has seen
Youth A use a vape in the car. When asked if there are any concerns
about staff providing substances to youth, Staff 4 reported she has
heard rumors that Staff 1 provides vapes to the youth. She stated
that she confronted Staff 1 about this rumor about two weeks ago
and Staff 1 denied it. Staff 4 reported she has no evidence of this
occurring but does see Staff 1 being more friendly with the youth.
Staff 4 reported she has never allowed youth to use a vape and does
not ever bring vapes to the facility.
Chief Administrator was interviewed face to face at the facility
on September 13, 2023, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker.
Law enforcement was present for this interview. Chief
Administrator had contacted this consultant on September 7, 2023,
about the reported concerns of allegations of staff providing vapes to
the youth and which staff were identified. An agency response plan
was developed where Staff 1, Staff 2, Staff 3, Staff 4, and Staff 5
were to not be left alone with a youth pending this investigation. On
September 13, 2023, Chief Administrator came to the end of Staff 4’s
interview and was asked about how Staff 4 was able to be left alone
with Youth A to confront the youth. Chief Administrator reported they
had the staffing planned out and this should have not been the case
but it was found two staff members called in on September 11, 2023,
which made it so accidentally Staff 4 was left with Youth A. Chief
Administrator noted staff were not notified of this safety plan as there
was already a plan set in place to over staff. She reported Staff 2
was notified since he was scheduled to work solo on a third shift and
was told due to an investigation he could not work solo.
Staff 5 was interviewed face to face at the facility on September
13, 2023, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Law enforcement
was present for this interview. Staff 5 reported she believes she is
being interviewed because Youth A disclosed that she does not feel
safe around her or other staff. Staff 5 reported they have never seen
a staff member offer vapes to youth or see a staff member or youth
vape in front of them. Staff 5 reported they did pick up Youth A from
school orientation with Staff 4. She reported she never saw or
smelled a vape being used. Staff 5 reported she was driving the van,
Youth A was sitting behind Staff 5, and Staff 4 was sitting in the
passenger front seat. Staff 5 reported she never saw Staff 4 pass a
vape to Youth A. She reported she knows Staff 4 does use a vape
but has never seen Staff 4 have a vape with them when working.
Staff 5 reported she went on the camping trip took Youth F to the
bathroom. She reported when they got to the bathroom, Youth A was
in a bathroom stall and Staff 1 was in there. She reported Staff 1
dropped something and Staff 5 asked Staff 1 “What the fuck is that”.
Staff 1 told Staff 5 that was her vape. Staff 5 reported because of this
she did not allow Youth F into the bathroom, and she walked out of
8

the bathroom. She stated Youth A was in the bathroom stall during
this time. Staff 5 reported they had never seen Staff 1 use the vape
and had never seen her offer a vape to the youth. She reported Staff
1 did transport Youth B to the campground that day in her own
vehicle. When asked if Staff 5 ever picked up Youth A from AWOL
she reported she did. Staff 5 explained she drove her own vehicle by
the apartment complex and saw Youth A, so she yelled at Youth A to
get into her vehicle since she was AWOL. When asked if she uses
CBD cigarettes, Staff 5 said she does but she did not use one in the
vehicle when she went to pick up Youth A. Staff 5 denied telling
Youth A about the CBD cigarette and denied Youth A ever talking
about it on the way back to the facility. Staff 5 believed Youth A has
said these things about her because Youth A was upset with her
after she was picked up from AWOL because she was disappointed
in her. When asked does she believed it was true that a staff member
could be providing substances to the youth, Staff 5 stated that it was
plausible. She stated that it could potentially be Staff 1 but does not
have evidence to back it up. She stated she does not believe Staff 4
is doing this because she is stricter with the youth. Staff 5 reported
she had heard rumors from the youth that Staff 2 had provided the
youth with alcohol and marijuana cartridges for vapes. She reported
she does not have evidence that this has happened but finds it
strange that the youth will do anything Staff 2 tells them to do without
having the strongest rapport with the youth. Staff 5 reported Staff 2
has made comments to her about making sure she is aware of all the
cameras in the facility and not to do certain things in front of the
camera.
Staff 6/ Complaint Source 2 was interviewed face to face at the
facility on September 13, 2023, in collaboration with MDHHS
Worker. Law enforcement was present for this interview. Staff 6
reported he was doing a check-in with Youth A on September 7,
2023, and they disclosed Staff 1 physically gave Youth A a vape,
Staff 3 and Staff 4 allowed Youth A to take a hit off a vape, and Staff
5 witnessed Youth A take a hit off Staff 4’s vape. Staff 6 reported he
has never witnessed this happening and has never seen Staff 1,
Staff 3, or Staff 4 use a vape at the facility. Staff 6 reported the use of
vapes is not allowed on the grounds of the facility and staff should
never offer any type of substance to a youth.
Staff 8 was interviewed face to face at the facility on September
13, 2023, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Law enforcement
was present for this interview. Staff 8 reported he does not have
any concerns with staff providing substances to the youth and has
never heard that concern before. He reported he works primarily on
third shift. Staff 8 noted when he has completed room checks, he has
seen Youth E crying and does not want to talk with him about it when
he offers. Staff 8 reported he has never forced anyone to give him a
9

hug but some of the youth have asked for one before which is always
just a side hug.
Therapist was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 11, 2023. Therapist reported she was present when
Youth A disclosed the allegation to Youth A’s Foster Care Worker.
She reported this was the first time she heard this disclosure and
Youth A was concerned about the staff members getting in trouble.
Therapist reported she has no further information but plans to
continue to check in with Youth A for support.
Conference call was held with MDHHS Worker on October 4,
2023. MDHHS worker reported there are no findings to the
investigation.
Documents Reviewed
- Email from Youth A’s Foster Care Worker/ Complaint
Source 1 dated 09/11/23- She reported she did not have any
additional information, and this is the first time of her hearing
this concern. Youth A’s Foster Care Worker reported Youth A
has experienced in the past with substances such as THC,
Nicotine, and/or alcohol.
- Text Message from Staff 5 to Staff 1 dated 09/13/2023 time
stamped 1:32pm- Staff 5 finished their interview with this
consultant, MDHHS worker, and law enforcement on 09/13/23
at 1:30pm. Staff 1 was interviewed by this consultant, MDHHS
worker, and law enforcement after Staff 5 was interviewed.
Staff 5 texted Staff 1: “I told them I went into the bathroom,
you said you dropped your vape, I didn’t let Youth F in then I
came in washed my hands, when I came in I said what the
fuck and you told me you dropped your vape. Then we went
to your grandma’s car and you showed us hats and Youth B
was running around.” This text message did line up with the
report Staff 5 made in her interview.
- Facility Tobacco Free Environment Policy revision date
02/01/2018- This policy notes tobacco use is prohibited on the
property of the Knapp Campus, staff are prohibited from any
tobacco use while with clients both on campus and off
campus, and employees are prohibited from any tobacco use
while transporting clients in the employee’s own and/or
agency owned/leased vehicles.
- Facility Incident Reports involving Youth A- On
07/16/2023, Youth A returned from AWOL and a vape pen
was taken from staff. Youth A reported they found the vape
pen on the side of the street. On 08/31/2023, Youth A turned
10

in a cigarette butt and a vape pen charger. There was no
report to where the youth got these items.
- Human Resource Files for Staff 1, Staff 3, Staff 4 and Staff
5- All noted staff’s employee files were reviewed and there
were no disciplinary actions noted in any files. All staff are up
to date on training requirements.
- Human Resource File for Staff 2- Staff 2 had one
disciplinary action and Staff 2 is up to date on all training
requirements.
Analysis Facility was found in compliance as during interviews only Youth A
reported staff provided vapes and alcohol. All staff and youth
interviewed denied this.
Consultation Provided:
- Consultation was provided about the concern of Staff 4
confronting Youth A about the allegations and making sure
trauma informed practice is occurring. The facility plans to
follow up with Staff 4.
- Consultation was provided to the facility due to the nature
of Youth A’s concern of what it will look like when staff are
to re-engage with Youth A due to the agency response
plan. Youth A’s therapist meet with Youth A about this and
they stated they had no concerns with the staff returning
and did not need further support.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 08/28/2023, youth had returned from AWOL, they were
walking with a peer, when staff member smacked youth in the
back of the head as hard as he could. It is unknown if youth had
injuries as a result of being smacked. Youth is in fear that "Staff 2
will beat their ass".
Investigation Interviews:
Staff 6/ Complaint Source 2 was interviewed face to face at the
facility on September 13, 2023, in collaboration with MDHHS
Worker. Law enforcement was present for this interview. Staff 6
reported he was doing a check-in with Youth A on September 7,
11

2023, and they disclosed Staff 2 slapped Youth A on the side of the
head on August 28, 2023. Staff 6 reported he had no other further
details and did not see the event occurred.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 11, 2023, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth
A reported when they came back from AWOL with Youth D about a
week and a half ago, Staff 2 smacked them on the right side of the
head when they were coming up the stairs. They reported when they
